I gained permission a while ago to add KAS tech to this parts pack. I might take this idea up, but I would like to learn to animate the part before I do this, so I can have an opening lid. What I really want to use KAS for is making a pack away shelter (tent?) that fits on the back and can be taken off and deployed, but I don't have the skills.

Make an extender twice the length of the current ones so vehicles can have a longer, more stable wheelbase and Dunabuggies can be built with dimensions like a real VW Bug based dune buggy. Long in front, short in back.
Due to the way ksp works, you don't really need a too long wheelbase. A wide wheelbase is oftenly more important.

I agree with both of you, a longer extender for coolness, but sideways tipping is a bigger problem for me in KSP than flipping. Wide wheelbase+ low center of gravity.

Any new pics? I can't wait for you to release the new parts!

Thanks guys! In real life I have been busy moving house (boring) AND having my first real life flying lesson (I have to get back up there ASAP! Brilliant!) Electricfox is too busy to help out, and Zitronen has other stuff to be getting on with (but he has offered to help with any plugin work or setting up wheels) So, its me only at the moment and progress hasn't been great. I'm not quitting though, just busy with other stuff that needs done. It'll take a while.

As the last screenshot had a military theme, I thought for balance I would make a screenshot more suited to the superior gender of our species. I would not want to appear sexist in any way and I'm not suggesting that ladies are not interested military stuff, but having said that, I would like to present the prototype for the rear wide extender, in HOT PINK!.....just look at all that room for the shopping!

Waiting patiently....

Due to the way ksp works, you don't really need a too long wheelbase. A wide wheelbase is oftenly more important.

While true, good luck fitting a decent amount of science equipment on a vehicle built with a short wheelbase.

That's one of the rovers I've built in career mode using these slidey wheels. It's virtually unflippable, even at 40+m/s, but due to it's relatively long wheelbase it can fit enough science gear to harvest entire nodes worth of science at once. So there is plenty of reason to have a long wheelbase in KSP.

It's also worth noting that that thing is bloody heavy. A hair over 2 tons last I checked. Need some carbon fiber chassis parts around here.....

Alrighty, excuse my impatience but I want that double seated rollkage NOW, now I say. Just messin kind of. Nice work, cant wait I love this stuff. I hate building rovers from I beams and square plates.
